ygData.subject: Re: get this
ygData.msgSnippet: I have also been told that everquest has never been balanced for pkill, it is not a pkill game, that was just thrown is as a request from some customers. The
ygData.messageBody:
I have also been told that everquest has never been balanced for pkill, it
is not a pkill game, that was just thrown is as a request from some
customers. The classes are balanced for grouping, but not for pkill. I have
also read that all tank types are getting smashed by pkill, as the mage
types target you... and blast you..you however have to stay on them in order
to hit them...if you have ever followed someone, expecially someone trying
to avoid you(zigging and zagging) it is very hard for you to hit them. As
soon as the mage gets away from you he zaps you, and he does not even have
to have you on his screen. All that I have read confirms this...If you think
chasing a monster down to hit him is hard, try chasing a player...
Throw in also pets, roots, sow etc...ermm...
EQ was not desighned for pkill...try it, you will find the warr types are no
match.
Morgul

----- Original Message -----
From: Countess Bathory <countess_bathory_69@...>
To: <shadowknight@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, May 04, 1999 5:50 PM
Subject: Re: [shadowknight] get this


> From: Countess Bathory <countess_bathory_69@...>
>
> I believe too that the Druid probably should have won, but it should at
> least have been a fight.
>
> It sounds like the SK was used to mop the floor.
>
> And the HT did an absolutely pitiful amount of damage.
> Which brings me back to my original complaints about the unreliability
> or our "special" weapon.
>
> Of course this does all depend on the types of weapons and armor both
> had and their skills in their weapon's type, offense and defense.
>
> But i have a feeling that the buffing skills of druids are just way
> more effective than any damage the SK could have done with his spells.
> Since a druid will do the same amount of melee damage with a chosen
> weapon as a SK, they have a distinct advantage.
>
> But we already know that SKs will be considerably weaker than most
> other classes at low-mid levels.
> I would like to hear from a SK 30+ and see if the clouds lining gets
> any shinier.
>
> Bathory
> Cazic-Thule
>
